meanings.definition: Having the same chemical structure as a substance produced in the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a bioidentical hormone to match what my body naturally makes.
meanings.sent2: She prefers bioidentical supplements that mimic the body's own chemicals.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my bioidentical vitamins were like having a mini-me inside me.
meanings.sent4: The bioidentical formula was like a mirror image of the body's natural compounds.
meanings.sent5: The bioidentical medication was designed to perfectly match the body's own substances.

meanings.definition: Relating to a hormone that is identical in structure to a hormone produced by the body.
meanings.sent1: The bioidentical hormone replacement therapy helped balance her levels.
meanings.sent2: He chose bioidentical hormones for their similarity to the body's own.
meanings.sent3: The idea of bioidentical hormones made her giggle at the thought of hormone twins.
meanings.sent4: Her body welcomed the bioidentical hormone like an old friend returning.
meanings.sent5: The bioidentical hormone acted as a perfect replica of the body's natural hormone.
